snippet: N.J.I.T., the only independent Division I college in the country, announced Thursday that it would break ground on a new, long-awaited $100 million multipurpose athletic facility this summer.
abstract: Men's basketball team of New Jersey Institute of Technology, country's only independent Division I college, has done well this season despite not belonging to any conference; athletic director Lenny Kaplan hopes successful record and construction of large, modern multi-purpose arena will draw interest from conferences.
lead_paragraph: N.J.I.T., the only independent Division I college in the country, announced Thursday that it would break ground on a new, long-awaited $100 million multipurpose athletic facility this summer.

headline.main: N.J.I.T. Will Get an Arena, but It Still Needs a Home
headline.print_headline: N.J.I.T. Will Get an Arena, but It Still Needs a Home
